meanings.definition: Tachinids: a family of flies known for parasitizing other insects.
meanings.sent1: Tachinids are flies that lay eggs on other insects.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study tachinids to learn about their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The tachinids decided to throw a party on the back of a ladybug.
meanings.sent4: The tachinids hovered over their prey like tiny, silent helicopters.
meanings.sent5: The tachinids swarmed around the caterpillar, ready to start their parasitic life cycle.

meanings.definition: Tachinids: relating to or characteristic of the family Tachinidae.
meanings.sent1: The tachinids family has many different species.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the tachinids behavior in detail.
meanings.sent3: The tachinids party was the most popular event in the insect world.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a tachinids curiosity for the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The tachinids characteristics make them stand out among other insects.

meanings.definition: Tachinids: a type of insect that belongs to the family Tachinidae.
meanings.sent1: The tachinids in the garden help control pest populations.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a tachinids flying near the flowers.
meanings.sent3: The tachinids threw a surprise birthday party for the butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The tachinids buzzed around like tiny guardians of the garden.
meanings.sent5: Children love to watch the tachinids as they go about their insect business.
